questions.question: Even though online classes were challenging at first, the students eventually ------- well.
questions.explanation: The sentence describes a situation in the past : “were challenging at first” → past tense “eventually” → indicates what happened later in that same past time frame Therefore, the verb should also be in the simple past tense . Why the other options are incorrect: খ) would adapt This is conditional or habitual future-in-the-past. There is no condition or repeated action implied here. গ) had adapted Past perfect is used when one past action happened before another past action . No such sequence is required here. ঘ) adapt This is the base form (present tense), which does not agree with the past context of the sentence.

questions.question: The laptop _____ last semester is already having technical
questions.explanation: The sentence describes a laptop purchased before another past reference point ( already having technical issues ). To indicate that one past action ( buying the laptop ) happened before another past action ( it having issues ), we use the past perfect tense : had bought . Why the other options are incorrect: ক) that he bought → simple past; could work in casual speech but does not clearly indicate the earlier past action . গ) that he buy → incorrect verb form; present tense, ungrammatical here. ঘ) he bought → grammatically incomplete as a relative clause; needs “that” . Final sentence: The laptop that he had bought last semester is already having technical problems.

questions.question: Neither of the students ------ their assignment before the deadline despite multiple reminders.
questions.explanation: Explanation: The subject “Neither of the students” is singular , so it takes a singular verb form . The action refers to a past event (before the deadline), so the simple past tense is appropriate. Correct sentence: Neither of the students submitted their assignment before the deadline despite multiple reminders. Why the other options are incorrect: ক) submit → Base form; incorrect for past tense context. খ) had submitted → Past perfect is unnecessary unless another past action is specified as occurring after this one. ঘ) would submit → Conditional/future; does not fit the past context. Note: Although “students” is plural, the phrase “neither of” makes the subject singular, so submitted is correct.

questions.question: It is high time students ---- mental health seriously and sought counseling when needed.
questions.explanation: The phrase “It is high time” is followed by a past tense verb to express a present or future necessity or urgency . This is a special usage called the subjunctive mood in English . So: It is high time students took mental health seriously… ✔ Why the other options are incorrect: ক) take → Present tense; not correct after “It is high time” খ) should take → Grammatically possible but not standard in this formal subjunctive construction ঘ) will take → Future tense; does not fit the “high time” expression Final sentence: It is high time students took mental health seriously and sought counseling when needed.

questions.option_b: No sooner they arrived at the conference venue than
questions.option_c: No sooner had they arrived at the conference venue then
questions.option_d: No sooner they had arrived at the conference venue then
questions.explanation: Explanation: In English, “No sooner…than” is a construction used to indicate that one event happens immediately after another. After “No sooner” , we use inversion (auxiliary before the subject) and “than” , not “then”. So the correct structure is: No sooner + had + subject + past participle + than + … Why the other options are incorrect: খ) No sooner they arrived… than → missing inversion ( should be “had they arrived” ) গ) No sooner had they arrived… then → wrong connector; must be than , not then ঘ) No sooner they had arrived… then → both wrong; missing inversion and wrong connector Final sentence: No sooner had they arrived at the conference venue than they realized their presentation file had been misplaced.

questions.question: If you had eaten a good breakfast, you --- so hungry now.
questions.explanation: This is a third conditional sentence with a present result (mixed conditional): If + past perfect → If you had eaten a good breakfast Result in the present → you wouldn’t be so hungry now Why the other options are incorrect: খ) can’t be Expresses present certainty, not a hypothetical result of a past condition. গ) won’t be Refers to the future, which does not match “now.” ঘ) would be Grammatically possible, but logically incorrect because eating a good breakfast would prevent hunger, not cause it. Final sentence: If you had eaten a good breakfast, you wouldn’t be so hungry now.

questions.question: ------ of the donors was willing to increase their donations and charity went broke.
questions.explanation: The sentence says: “------ of the donors was willing to increase their donations and charity went broke.” The context indicates that no donor was willing , which explains why the charity failed. None fits logically and grammatically: None of the donors was willing… ✅ Why the other options are incorrect: ক) Each → Implies every donor was willing → contradicts “charity went broke.” খ) Both → Implies only two donors, also willing → contradicts context. গ) Many → Implies several donors were willing → again, contradicts the charity going broke. Final sentence: None of the donors was willing to increase their donations and charity went broke.

questions.question: Did you hear what my boss ---- about his boss?
questions.explanation: The sentence is: "Did you hear what my boss ---- about his boss?" Here, the correct word is “said” because: We use “say” when reporting general speech or information . “Tell” usually requires a direct object : “tell someone something.” Correct answer: খ) said

questions.question: -- the rain and the high winds, they never went camping.
questions.explanation: The sentence is: "-- the rain and the high winds, they never went camping." We need a word/phrase that shows contrast , because even though there was rain and high winds, they still never went camping . ক) Because → shows reason ❌ খ) Despite → shows contrast ✅ গ) Due to → shows reason ❌ ঘ) However → usually starts a new sentence ❌ ✅ Correct answer: খ) Despite

questions.question: I arrived over an hour late to the office and everyone was working. Actually, they ----- for over two hours on the new project and I felt really guilty.
questions.explanation: The sentence sets up a past reference point : “I arrived over an hour late to the office” → a specific moment in the past. Then it describes an action that started earlier and continued up to that past moment : “for over two hours on the new project” → duration before arrival. To express an action that was ongoing before another past action , we use the past perfect continuous tense . So: they had been working for over two hours ✔ Why the other options are incorrect: ক) work Present tense; does not fit a past narrative. খ) worked Simple past; does not emphasize the duration and continuity before arrival. ঘ) was working Past continuous, but it describes an action happening at a specific past time, not one that started earlier and continued up to that time. Final sentence: Actually, they had been working for over two hours on the new project and I felt really guilty.

questions.explanation: Prerogative refers to a special right, advantage, or privilege that belongs to a particular person or group, often by virtue of position or status. Why the other options are incorrect: ক) a diplomatic document → This describes a formal paper, not a right or privilege. গ) the ability to make financial success → This refers to skill or opportunity for profit, unrelated to prerogative. ঘ) an indirect suggestion for an individual → This describes a hint or innuendo, not a right or privilege. Example sentence: It is the manager’s prerogative to approve or reject leave requests.

questions.question: A formal composition or speech expressing high praise of somebody is -----.
questions.explanation: Eulogy means a formal speech or written composition that expresses high praise , especially for a person (often delivered on ceremonial occasions). Why the other options are incorrect: খ) deflation — an economic term meaning a general decrease in prices. গ) stagflation — an economic condition combining stagnation and inflation. ঘ) stagnation — lack of growth or activity, often used in economics. Conclusion: The correct answer is eulogy .

options.text: the act of killing a king or a queen

questions.option_b: killing someone of a royal family
questions.option_c: the act of killing a king or a queen
questions.explanation: Regicide comes from Latin: rex (king) + -cide (killing). It specifically refers to the act of killing a reigning monarch . Why the other options are incorrect: ক) elimination of a racial group → This describes genocide , not regicide. খ) killing someone of a royal family → Too broad; regicide refers only to the monarch , not any royal family member. ঘ) the murder of one's brother → This is called fratricide , unrelated to kings. Example sentence: The regicide of King Charles I shocked England in the 17th century.

questions.question: A 'dictum' refers to ----.
questions.explanation: Dictum means a statement, assertion, or authoritative pronouncement , often expressing a general truth or principle. Therefore, “a true statement” best matches its meaning. Why the other options are incorrect: ক) a financial statement This refers to accounting documents (e.g., balance sheet, income statement). A dictum has no financial or accounting-specific meaning. খ) a list of precedence This relates to ranking or order of importance. A dictum is a single statement or saying, not a list or hierarchy. গ) a feeling of hatred This describes an emotion (such as hatred or hostility ). A dictum is verbal or written in nature, not an emotional state.

questions.question: The word 'shrug' indicating doubt or indifference is associated with
questions.explanation: To shrug means to raise one’s shoulders slightly , often to indicate doubt, indifference, or lack of knowledge . Example: When asked about the delay, he just shrugged. Why the other options are incorrect: ক) head → nodding or shaking the head conveys agreement or disagreement, not shrugging. খ) forehead → unrelated to the action of shrugging. ঘ) face → shrugging primarily involves shoulders, not facial expression (though expressions may accompany it). Conclusion: The gesture of shrugging is associated with the shoulders .

questions.question: "We couldn't but shed tears when beholding the sight." This is a ---.
questions.explanation: Main clause: We couldn't but shed tears Subordinate clause: when beholding the sight (adverbial clause of time) So structurally, it has one main clause + one dependent clause → this is a complex sentence .

questions.explanation: Explanation: Observe the transformation in the first pair: BART → ABTR Label the positions of letters in BART : B A R T The rearrangement follows this order: 2nd letter → A 1st letter → B 4th letter → T 3rd letter → R So the pattern is 2 – 1 – 4 – 3 . Now apply the same pattern to CART : C A R T Rearranging as 2 – 1 – 4 – 3 gives: A (2) C (1) T (4) R (3) Result: ACTR Therefore, the correct option is: ঘ — ACTR .

questions.question: X introduces Y saying, "He is the husband of the granddaughter of the father of my father." How is Y related to X?

But normally, we consider the lineage down . Usually, it refers to X’s father’s daughter , i.e., X’s sister or X himself if male . But we want a granddaughter , so next generation → X’s daughter .
